title: John Baldessari (lettering)
content:
Hello,  
Wondering if there is a font that resembles this lettering, or if it is based on a font?  
Thanks in advance!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317132034im_/http:/typophile.com/files/tumblr_l8wmvjeILz1qalq4so1_500_4232.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317132034im_/http:/typophile.com/files/6a00e39826d2c78833011572136670970b-800wi_4184.jpg)

Font: 

 WRONG 

Solved By: 

 [Ryuk](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317132034/http:/typophile.com/user/22675 "View user profile.")
author: Emma-L

comments.content:
The thinner lettering reminds me of [Charmante](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317132034/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/juraj-chrastina/charmante/?refby=bowfin) by Juraj Chrastina.

- Mike Yanega

My first thoughts were… [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/pintassilgo/marujo/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317132034/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/pintassilgo/marujo/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/pintassilgo/marujo/")

But obviously not the answer you were looking for.

The font is called ' [WRONG](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317132034/http:/content-object.com/filter/Artists-projects/Baldessari-Wrong-Font-for-LACMA-s-2011-Art-Film-Gala)' and has been designed by Kimberly Varella.
Great find Ryuk - how did you do that?

Was lucky for this one. As I didn't know it, I simply used 'Baldessari' as keyword to search over [What The Font Forum](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317132034/http:/www.myfonts.com/WhatTheFont/forum/?q=Baldessari). Answer was on the first post.
